title: How to automatically make the reply From the address the same as original To address.
content:
Hi All, I have a domain name where all the emails sent to it is placed in my email server.

I randomly provide all my contacts with their own email address: eg mozilla@domain.com

Thunderbird also allows me to customise the From address.

Now, when I want to reply to one of these emails, instead of making the From the same as the To address of the original email (mozilla@domail.com), it has the Account email address (account@domain.com).

Quite often I forget to check the From address and send it. This has been confusing for the recipient, and myself, so say the least.

I've check the internet, including this forum, and it seems to be a common complaint.

However, I've found no solutions. Surely it cant be that hard to make the reply From address the same as the To address of the original email!
creator: firefox1748

title: Cancellazione email
content:
Buongiorno, ho riscontrato un problema nella mia casella di posta: le email in arrivo più vecchie di circa 14 giorni si cancellano in automatico (ad esempio, ad oggi riesco a visualizzare solo le email dal 9 gennaio 2023, quelle precedenti sono state eliminate). Non riesco a capire quale sia la motivazione.

Resto in attesa di un Vostro gentile supporto.

Ringrazio e porgo cordiali saluti

Federica Di Leo
creator: federicadileo

title: New account set up problem, Authentication failure while connecting to server outlook.office365.com
content:
I have an email address at an organization that uses Office365. I am able to log in, read and send emails using Outlook either as a standalone app or through a browser. I can also do the same on my desktop with Thunderbird. It's version 102.6.1 (64-bit) running on Windows 10. I must have logged in ages ago and I don't need to do it daily. I use the 2FA mandated by my organization when I log in with Outlook.

Thunderbird is so much better in many ways that I'd like to use it on my laptop as well, but when I try to set it up, it just replies with "Authentication failure while connecting to server outlook.office365.com" even though even the 2FA succeeds. This is a laptop with Windows 10 and TB 102.7.0 (64-bit)

I have checked that (suggestions from other threads): -Cached connections is 1 -IPv6 disabled -Cookies enabled -I cannot set up a app password. I guess not allowed by my organization.

Settings are typical, server outlook.office365.com, 993, SSL/TLS, OAuth2. All that works on TB on the other computer.

Thanks for any suggestions!
creator: jere2

title: Messaggi che non arrivano al destinatario
content: Buongiorno, dalla mia casella di posta elettronica, dopo che ho inviato il messaggio, mi arriva un messaggio di errore "Message undeliverable" con scritto "Your message did not reach some or all of the intended recipients". Questo succede anche in due messaggi diversi a due destinatari diversi. Avrei bisogno di risolvere il problema urgentemente, grazie. Francesco Pazzini --RIMOSSO--@studiofps.it --RIMOSSO--

title: Interrupción del funcionamiento de cuentas Office365 en Thunderbird
content:
Estimados

Hace algunos días se instaló una actualización (Version 102.7.0) de Thunderbird, a partir de lo cual dos cuentas de correo Office365 que operaban con normalidad dejaron de funcionar, apareciendo un mensaje de error de conexión con el servidor de Outlook. He leído y tratado de aplicar las recomendaciones que se mencionan en los sitios de soporte. Finalmente, como última alternativa, eliminé las cuentas e intenté volver a instalarlas lo que ya no es posible; aunque me indica que la configuración (IMAP) fue encontrada en la base de datos ISP de Mozilla, ya que me indica que no se ha logrado comprobar la configuración y que intente con otro protocolo. Agradeceré la respuesta que puedan brindarme sobre este particular. Saludos

creator: SumoBot

title: Space for Text Above Signature When Forwarding
content:
I am running Thunderbird 102.7.0 on MacOS 13.0.1. When Replying or Forwarding I have set up my reply to appear above the original message and my signature below my reply and above the quoted message. When I select Reply to an email there is space for my text to be added above the signature and it appears in the normal font and format I use for email text, however when I select to Forward an email there is no space above the signature and any text I enter appears in the same font and format as the signature text.

I also note that if I close the "Forwarded" email without making any change the window asking if I want to discard changes pops up whereas when I close a "Reply'd" email without any changes the the email window close without asking about discarding changes.

Is there some setting that I do not see that will correct this Forwarding behaviour or is a correction part of an upcoming release?

In past releases the Forward signature did leave space for text above the signature.

Thank you,
creator: ecbc

title: Adding New Email Account - Incoming Server Exists message
content:
Mon, Jan 23, 2023 (01:32pm EST)

Ok Guys,

I know you are all very busy, but how long should it take to perfect the "ADD NEW EMAIL ACCOUNT" option in Thunderbird.

I have always had problems (from years ago) adding new Email Accounts, I've learned to manually change the username to reflect, the full email address not just the name, (left of the @ symbol.)

Solution - include the full name ex: "Name@Domain" rather than Name, it would be such a great advancement.

Secondly,

Now on this latest release of Thunderbird (102.7l.00) and a little prior

I have been running into this Strange problem

Every time I add a New Email Account, and click on Done, It spins, and spins, while I wait for TB to add the New Email. and apparently, it never does.

Same problems as before: the Username is incomplete, which is a pain I manually have to configure it and I re submit the Task, and it comes back " Incoming Server Exists Message" Error Message

After maybe 10 years of developing Thunderbird, I cannot understand why this basic of all basic procedure is flawed.

FYI - I have spent the past 1 hour trying to add an email account - and it will not work.

You have any solutions?

Thank you in advance.
creator: icenews

title: Komunikace se servery přes TLS/SSL.
content: Thunderbird odmítá komunikovat s mailservery přes zabezpečené spojení SSL/TLS. Přes nezabezpečené spojení komunikace funguje, ale to nechci používat. Provozovatel serveru tvrdí, že na jeho straně je vše v pořádku, chyba je prý v TB. Při pokusu o spojení se zobrazí hláška: Při TLS spojení nastala chyba, kterou nelze obejít. Server imap.seznam.cz pravděpodobně nepodporuje kompatibilní verzi TLS nebo certifikátu, nebo došlo k chybě při navazování spojení. Mám aktuální verzi TB, os win 10.
creator: SumoBot

title: have to enter account password every time thunderbird starts
content: Every time I start Thunderbird version 102.7.0 during the day I have to enter each accounts password. Or when TB recheck mail on a cycle of 10 minutes I have to do it again. The saved password table is all ways empty whether I say save password or not. I can only say this is a new bug because older versions you only had to log into user accounts with password only one time after the account was created and never again. The saved password table has no manual way to enter password into the saved password table. This needs to be corrected to the old method of doing things because this is such a pain that it will drive away TB user to use some other email reader.

title: address book corrupted
content:
I have used Thunderbird for many, many years. Never had a problem until lately when I moved to a new computer. I now have a problem with "address book". Problem could be either import or export or in the use of address book. The problem may have started when I moved the address book from my old computer (Win 10 pro 64 bit, Thunderbird 102.6.1) to a new computer (Win 11-Pro, Thunderbird 102.7.0, 64-bit) Old computer is OK, new computer has error.

Error: Start to display "inbox" then click -> Tools-> address book. Address book displays, BUT display in on half line spacing, not the normal full line spacing - if correct data displays correctly. In half line spacing, lines overlay each other. Also I can not modify a contact and I can not add a new contact.

I have only one profile, no extras on Thunderbird. When I click on a contact that display incorrectly I get a grey box (almost the whole display) and I can not type into that box. Can not close that box, can not go back, can only close tab.

Tried on web to backup address book. In command prompt (the old DOS) with current directory set to: "C:\" typed "dir *.mab /s". Result: "file not found". I can not find any "mab" file anywhere on C:. (Windows is installed on C:. One problem you probably know, when Thunderbird is updated, help files on Web are not updated. (Example web states to go to "run", can not find "run" on Thunderbird menu). Went through many sites on web, can not find file containing address book and can it not back it up, can not fix it, can not where it is. Looked at profile at What went wrong? I am out of luck.

My background: Worked on PC since Windows 3, I am comfortable on PC/Win, repair PCs, etc.

Sorry to bring you this, can not figure this on out. Gerry
creator: gehcarve

title: Possibility of making plugins for Thunderbird calendar?
content:
I'd like to make a plugin that adds an icon to the days of the calendar indicating the phase the Moon will have on that day.

There seems to be little up to date documentation on making extensions for Thunderbird's built in browser and there doesn't seem to be any information on making plugins that change the calendar. Is it even possible to make such a plugin? If so, what is a good starting point for learning how to do so?

Cheers.
